title: Senior Accountant (They/She/He)
content:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride. 
A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone. 
We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together. 
 
Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries. Every year, +200k merchants generate over 4B‚Ç¨ in sales through our platform and over 20M customers get their goods delivered in minutes.
Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.
What makes our ride unique? 
ü§ù Our culture and strong values. 

We have an ‚Äò‚Äôoffice-first‚Äô‚Äô culture and we place collaboration at the center of everything we do! 
We have a non-vanilla personality and feedback mindset. We don‚Äôt shy away from difficult conversations - we see them as a gift! 
We work with high intensity and have fun along the way.  We also celebrate the wins (a lot!). 
We celebrate diversity in all its forms and foster an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. 

üí™Our career development philosophy. 

We are building a talent house of high performing teams and leaders. We invest in people who raise the bar and help others reach their full potential. 
We take ownership of our career development. We don‚Äôt believe in linear and predictable career paths - we create the job of our dreams! 
We embrace opportunities to move the needle and make an impact beyond our scope. 

ü§ùOur commitment to being a force for good. 

Our platform is an important economic tool for millions of people (customers, partners, couriers) and we are taking action to amplify our positive impact. 
We invest in doing good by dedicating time and resources into social and environmental initiatives. 
We have the ambition of being DIB role models across the tech industry. We are creating environments, systems, and processes that provide equal opportunities, break biases, and empower our communities.

 
We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.
 
YOUR MISSION
We‚Äôre looking for someone to join our Accounting team, you‚Äôll be working with and alongside talented and passionate people around the world. We are looking for a highly accountable, flexible individual, who is technically excellent, works hard, can nurture productive working relationships, and operate with a considerable degree of autonomy.
THE JOURNEY
Perform a variety of accounting activities including but not limited to:


Participation in establishing new accounting processes and streamlining existing processes


Reconciliation of GL account balances and bank statements, maintaining general ledger and preparing month-end closing procedures


Stock management


Work with primary accounting documents


Ensuring that financial transactions are properly recorded


Spot errors and suggest ways to improve efficiency


Fixed assets ledger maintenance


Inter-company accounts reconciliation and confirmation process


Preparing the monthly profit and loss, and balance sheet reports


Reconciliation between Trial Balance and Management Reporting     


Assisting the Finance Manager and HQ with developing and documentation of business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls


Ensure compliance with local GAAP principles


Maintain and develop relationship with internal and external parties of the Company


Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference


WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE RIDE


Bachelor's degree in accounting/finance (ACCA/CPA Certification would be considered an advantage)


5+ years accounting experience in a similar position


Experience of working in the Retail sector or in Accounting Consultancy Services 


Thorough knowledge of the International Accounting Standards (IAS)


Experience with accounting systems (NAVision and Pantheon are strong advantage)


Advanced MS Excel Skills (pivot tables, sumifs, vlookup, Charts etc) & Google Workspace


Knowledge of the English and local language (advanced)


Analytical and problem-solving skills


Excellent organizational skills


High levels of professionalism, initiative, and energy


An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude



Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.


We believe driven talent deserves:

üåüAn enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings with zero delivery fees on all Glovo orders!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏èFlexible time off (uncapped vacation days) , the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.
üìö An external learning budget to fuel your thirst for knowledge and personal growth.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard. 
Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life? 
Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!


Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your
application will be collected by GlovoApp23, S.L. (“Controller”), which is located at
C/ Pujades 94, 08005, Barcelona, Spain. Controller’s data protection officer belongs to
the legal team and can be contacted at legal@glovoapp.com. Your personal
data will be processed for the purposes of the Controller’s recruitment related
activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for
applicants, contacting previous companies where the applicant has been
employed in order to check references (upon prior consent from the applicant),
evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and, as is otherwise needed in the
recruitment and hiring processes - such may be analysing your skills for the
proposed role, The Controller may also use your data to present different roles
that may suit your interests and/or skills. Such processing is legally permissible
under Art. 6(1)(a), (b) and (f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection
Regulation) based on the consent of the applicant by submitting the
application, as necessary for the purposes of conducting precontractual
activities, directly requested by the applicant by submitting the candidature,
addressed to analyse the possibilities of establishing a labour relation between
the Controller and the applicant, and for the legitimate interests pursued by the
Controller, which are the application, evaluation, and selection of applicants for
employment.
Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc. of whom are a
cloud services and applicant tracking provider located in the United States of
America and engaged by the Controller to help manage their recruitment and
hiring processes. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States,
your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it to
this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that the
United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for
personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to
appropriate additional safeguards under either the standard contractual clauses
and/or the Privacy Shield. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual
clauses by contacting us at legal@glovoapp.com. At the same time, your data
and the inputs of the recruitment process will be stored on Google, Inc and
Amazon Web Services servers, acting as processors, both of which comply with
the General Data Protection Regulations and have a written agreement with the
Controller. Depending on the offer applied, your personal information may be
transferred to other companies of the Controller’s group for the same purposes
as established before and acting as a processor.
Your personal data will be retained by the Controller as long as needed to fulfil
the requirements of the above mentioned purposes. In case the recruitment
process does not end with the establishment of a labour relationship between
the applicant and the Controller, the Controller will retain the applicant’s data for
a period of 3 years from the date of the last communication, issued either by You
or the Controller, declaring the end of the recruitment process without sending
and/or accepting the possible offer.
Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to
request that your personal data be rectified, cancelled or erased, and/or to
request that processing of your personal data be limited. In case You consider

your rights have been violated, you also have to right to data portability. In
addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority.
By consenting and submitting the candidature, the applicant confirms that they
have read and are informed about the processing of personal data by the
Controller and gives the necessary consent to comply with Controller’s activities
regarding the recruitment process.
